thread.title: Shhh…The Indo-Pak secert draft between Manmohan Singh and Narendra Modi
thread.title_full: Shhh…The Indo-Pak secert draft between Manmohan Singh and Narendra Modi

author: Nithya Nair | India.com News Desk
title: Shhh…The Indo-Pak secert draft between Manmohan Singh and Narendra Modi
text:
Shhh…The Indo-Pak secert draft between Manmohan Singh and Narendra Modi By India.com News Desk on October 8, 2015 at 7:36 PM Comments Bihar, Oct 8: To bring a final end to the ongoing trouble between the warring nations, India and Pakistan, former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and Pakistan military ruler General Pervez Musharraf had drafted a framework agreement on Jammu and Kashmir during the Congress’ rule in the nation. The draft has been kept as a secret since then, as per Indian Express Report. According to a senior Indian diplomat, the documents which lie unsigned between both the parties were personally handed over to Prime Minister Narendra Modi by Dr Manmohan Singh on May 27, 2014. The secret file had ’consultative mechanism’ to address regional ‘social and economic issues’, like tourism, religious pilgrimages, culture and trade reported Indian Express . In Indian edition of former Pakistan Foreign Minister Khurshid Kasuri’s book, Neither a Hawk Nor a Dove — the first insider account of India-Pakistan secret diplomacy on Kashmir’ book quotes General Musharraf as stating that the secret draft is a Kashmir agreement which request for joint management by both India and Pakistan, as well as demilitarisation of the territory. (Also Read- Pakistan’s proliferation track record should be considered before any nuke deal with it: India) Ambassador Satinder Lambah, General Musharraf’s interlocutors, Riaz Muhammad Khan and Tariq Aziz were personally chosen by Dr Singh for formulating the draft. The draft was completed after more than 200 hours of discussion and 30 meets in Dubai and Kathmandu. Ceasefire violation from across the border had become a common issue at the Indo-Pak border since the beginning of this year. DG level talks were also conducted between both the countries, but with no effect.
